benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/emails/{email} - Delete email from account

covered: DELETE guideline - Valid Deletion: Successful 204 responses with verification that the email is removed (TC01, TC02, TC12, TC13, TC14, TC17, TC18).
DELETE guideline - Non-Existent Resource: 404 when account or email is not found, including accounts with no emails (TC03, TC04, TC09).
DELETE guideline - Concurrency: Parallel deletes yield one 204 and remaining 404s (TC15).
Input validation: 400 for invalid accountId/email formats and rejection of injected values (TC05, TC06, TC16).
Header validation: Required X-Killbill-CreatedBy enforced (400 when missing) and optional Reason/Comment accepted (TC07, TC02).
Server-side robustness: 503 dependency failure scenario covered (TC11).
Resilience and performance: retry on transient network failures (TC19) and response-time SLA (TC14).
Tolerating unsupported query params without failure (TC08).
gaps: DELETE guideline - Soft Deletes: No scenario verifies soft-delete behavior or audit trail (e.g., resource flagged as deleted vs permanently removed).
Content negotiation and body semantics: No assertions that 204 responses have an empty body and appropriate headers; error responses are not validated for application/json content type and schema.
Idempotency (sequential): No test showing a second DELETE on the same email returns the expected code consistently (e.g., 404 on repeat).
URL encoding and special characters in path: No tests for emails requiring percent-encoding or plus tags (e.g., first.last+tag@example.com) to ensure proper decoding.
Authorization (Forbidden): No 403 case for authenticated user lacking permission/role to delete emails.
Audit logging: No verification that X-Killbill-CreatedBy/Reason/Comment are persisted in audit logs for the deletion event.
Failure invariants: In error cases (e.g., 503), no check that the email remains present (no partial deletion).
Boundary negatives: No tests for whitespace/empty CreatedBy header value or overlong header values leading to 400.
recommendations: Add a soft-delete/audit scenario: perform DELETE, then verify via audit/log API that the deletion is recorded with CreatedBy/Reason/Comment; clarify and test whether the system uses soft or hard deletes.
Assert response semantics: for 204 ensure no response body; for 4xx/5xx ensure Content-Type: application/json and validate error schema (code/message).
Add sequential idempotency test: DELETE once (204), DELETE again (expect 404 unless API specifies idempotent 204), and document the contract.
Add URL-encoding tests: DELETE on emails like first.last+tag@example.com and addresses with percent-encoded characters, verifying correct routing and deletion.
Add a 403 authorization test: authenticated user without required scope/role attempts deletion and receives 403.
Verify failure invariants: after simulated 503, assert the email still exists (no partial state change).
Negative header validation: test empty/blank X-Killbill-CreatedBy and excessively long values to confirm 400 with clear validation errors.
